author: m.kalinin
content: FWIW, if EL hadn't received `fcU` with `payloadAttributes` which induced a payload build process then `getPayload` would error in response. It looks like `prepare` API call must be called, otherwise, block proposal fails

author: m.kalinin
content: CL won't vote if a block isn't fully validated yet. From this standpoint it's an optimisation, i.e. you're optimising CL for faster resolution of "not yet validated" status. And in some circumstances this optimisation is valuable e.g. when EL responses with `SYNCING` and needs to execute a couple of blocks that are `VALID` which is doable in a sub slot time interval.

author: sauliusgrigaitis
content:
Thanks Mikhail, I think I just interpret the specification slightly different. "A validator should create and broadcast the attestation to the associated attestation subnet when either (a) the validator _has received a valid block_ from the expected block proposer for the assigned slot..." - in my understanding this is the moment when EL validates the payload. So in my understanding, in order to implement this spec there should be a way to immediately inform CL that when EL validates the payload (in case of `SYNCING`). Otherwise we have a case where in fact the node _has received a valid block_ and EL knows about it, howerever, CL doesn't know about it. 

But I hear you, it seems that the general idea is that this is just too small detail in the big picture.
